de.iabg.mode.io
Class NastranDirectMatrixReader

java.lang.Object
  java.io.Reader
      java.io.InputStreamReader
          java.io.FileReader
              de.iabg.mode.io.NastranDirectMatrixReader
All Implemented Interfaces:
MaterialReader, java.io.Closeable, java.lang.Readable
public class NastranDirectMatrixReader
extends java.io.FileReader
implements MaterialReader

This implementation of MaterialReader parses a Nastran file containing symmetric matrices representing the mass matrix, stiffness matrix, or other data. Refer to MaterialReader class API for more details. The Nastran file can contain an undefined number of mass or stiffness matrices, with each matrix having a name or identifier. This parser is designed to read in all of this data, however, non-symmetric matrices such as force vectors, are omitted. Refer to the latest version of the MSC.Nastran Quick Reference Guide for more information for the file format.

Version:
Septmeber 13, 2008
Author:
Adam C. Dick, BSE

importMassMatrices

public void importMassMatrices(MassMatrixMap massMatrices)
Description copied from interface: MaterialReader
Clears the given mass matrices and replaces them with the data parsed from the internally stored file. This method should be called after MaterialReader.readFile(), otherwise no data will be saved.

Specified by:
importMassMatrices in interface MaterialReader
Parameters:
massMatrices - the MassMatrixMap where the data will be stored

readFile

public void readFile()
              throws java.io.IOException
Description copied from interface: MaterialReader
Internally saves the data from the file for later use. The format of the lines may be altered as required to more easily parse the file.

Specified by:
readFile in interface MaterialReader
Throws:
java.io.IOException - if the file could not be read
